content.question: Comparison of DNA sequences in Table II suggests that a functional GULO gene in lemurs can have a G, C, or T at position 21 but only a G at position 22. Which of the following pairs of predictions is most helpful in explaining the discrepancy?

choices.label: A substitution at position 21 would result in A substitution at position 22 would result in No change to the protein A premature stop codon or an amino acid with different biochemical characteristics
A substitution at position 21 would result in A substitution at position 22 would result in A different amino acid A premature stop codon or an amino acid with different biochemical characteristics
A substitution at position 21 would result in A substitution at position 22 would result in No change to the protein A frame shift producing an inactive protein
A substitution at position 21 would result in A substitution at position 22 would result in An amino acid with different biochemical characteristics No transcription of the gene

content.answer: A substitution at position 21 would result in A substitution at position 22 would result in No change to the protein A premature stop codon or an amino acid with different biochemical characteristics

skill.text: 3.B: State the null hypothesis or predict the results of an experiment.
